text: The Salisbury Mills–Cornwall station is a commuter rail stop on the Metro- North Railroad's Port Jervis Line, located in the Town of Cornwall in Orange County, New York. The station is located along the former Erie Railroad Graham Line immediately west of the Moodna Viaduct. A recent renovation has expanded the station's parking lot, lengthened the platform canopy, added new lighting, and added a mini high-level platform for wheelchair access to trains. Parking fees are charged on weekdays, with both permit and metered spaces available. ==Station layout== This station has one track and a low-level side platform. {|cellspacing=0 cellpadding=3 |style="border-top:solid 1px gray; border- bottom:solid 1px gray" rowspan=3 width=75|Ground/ Platform level |style="border-top:solid 1px gray;" width=100|Track 1 |style="border-top:solid 1px gray;" width=450|← toward Port Jervis (Campbell Hall) toward Hoboken (Harriman) → |- |style="border-bottom:solid 1px gray;border- right:solid 2px black;border-left:solid 2px black;border-top:solid 2px black;text-align:center;" colspan=2|Side platform, doors will open on the left or right |- |style="border-bottom:solid 1px gray;"|Street level |style="border-bottom:solid 1px gray;"|Ticket machine and parking |- |} == References == == External links == * *Happy 100th Birthday Moodna Viaduct Video taken August 2007 showing the span. title: Salisbury Mills–Cornwall station
